Description: Postcard; printed; photograph showing an Egyptian glass portrait, believed to be of Amenhotep II, in the Corning Museum of Glass.
Producer name: Published by: Corning Museum of Glass
Curator's comments: Modern card; postally used; postmarked 16th March 2014. The message reads: "Day Five. Apart from the museum, they have an amazing research library here, known as the Rakow, with free photocopying & scanning facilities. Discovered a copy of a 1964 Japanese exhib. catalogue of treasures from the Kabul museum which I've previously failed to track down but which has photos of pieces since stolen. And they have a buzzing studio full of individuals, children & artists making glass objects or vessels. We had a demo yesterday by one of the world's leading glass artists, who presented a huge vessel afterwards to the museum in David's memory". The sender was at a conference in Corning at the time. See also EPH-ME.2494-2496.
Associated names: Associated with: Dr St John Simpson
